City Connects Neighborhoods to Sewer

As the City continues to grow, more neighborhoods are applying to the program.

Several Bend neighborhoods have successfully connected to public sewer through the Septic to Sewer Conversion Program which allows people to convert from private septic systems to City sewer service and is funded through utility rates.
Post Date: 08/25/2021 9:19 AM 
City Connects Neighborhoods to Sewer 

 

Several Bend neighborhoods have successfully connected to public sewer through the Septic to Sewer Conversion Program [ https://www.bendoregon.gov/city-projects/infrastructure-projects/septic-to-sewer-conversion-program?medium=email&source=govdelivery ] which allows people to convert from private septic systems to City sewer service and is funded through utility rates.

 

The Via Sandia, East Lake, and Orion neighborhoods in southeast Bend applied to the program and were approved for funding in early 2020. The project allowed 42 homeowners to decommission their aging septic systems and connect to public sewer. Sewer construction began in March 2021 and was completed in August 2021, ahead of schedule and within budget. 

 

The Septic to Sewer Conversion Program is an ongoing effort allowing residents to apply annually to complete a sewer project in an area where properties are currently served by private onsite septic systems. Some residents are converting to sewer because their privately-owned septic systems are failing. Others are connecting because it allows them to develop their properties further, as improvements on properties with septic systems are limited. 

 

As the City continues to grow, more neighborhoods are applying to the program. If you are interested in learning more or applying to the program, visit bendoregon.gov/septictosewerprogram [ https://www.bendoregon.gov/city-projects/infrastructure-projects/septic-to-sewer-conversion-program?medium=email&source=govdelivery ].

 

Wheelchair 

Accommodation Information for People with Disabilities

To obtain this information in an alternate format such as Braille, large print, electronic formats, etc. please contact Anne Aurand at aaurand@bendoregon.gov or 541-388-5573; Relay Users Dial 7-1-1.

Click here for more information [ https://www.bendoregon.gov/Home/Components/News/News/4723/?medium=email&source=govdelivery ] 

SUBSCRIBER SERVICES:

Manage Subscriptions [ https://public.govdelivery.com/accounts/ORBEND/subscriber/edit?preferences=true#tab1 ]  |  Unsubscribe All [ https://public.govdelivery.com/accounts/ORBEND/subscriber/one_click_unsubscribe?verification=5.4f82a43501e64d9aa86e1a7aaf8bf3de&destination=i7z7x0u9w6y3p7r3%40co-labconsultancy.slack.com ]  |  Help [ https://subscriberhelp.govdelivery.com/ ]

 
________________________________________________________________________

This email was sent to i7z7x0u9w6y3p7r3@co-labconsultancy.slack.com using GovDelivery Communications Cloud, on behalf of: City of Bend, Oregon · 710 NW Wall St. · Bend, OR 97703 GovDelivery logo [ https://subscriberhelp.granicus.com/?medium=email&source=govdelivery ]

files.name: Statewide Outdoor Mask Mandate | Free Training | Workshops for Restaurant Employees | RFP Opportunity | Grant Writing Workshop
files.title: Statewide Outdoor Mask Mandate | Free Training | Workshops for Restaurant Employees | RFP Opportunity | Grant Writing Workshop
files.subject: Statewide Outdoor Mask Mandate | Free Training | Workshops for Restaurant Employees | RFP Opportunity | Grant Writing Workshop
files.plain_text:
To view this email online, paste this link into your browser:
https://t.e2ma.net/message/dyyybh/966v8kob





  Aug. 25, 2021                                                                                                                                                                                          Photo by Andrea Johnson  

Governor Brown Announces Statewide Outdoor Mask Requirement

Yesterday, Governor Kate Brown announced new statewide outdoor mask requirements to help stop the spread of the highly contagious Delta variant. Effective Friday, August 27, masks will be required in most public outdoor settings, including large outdoor events, where physical distancing is not possible, and regardless of vaccination status. The Oregon Health Authority (OHA) also strongly recommends masking for outdoor gatherings at private residences when individuals from different households do not consistently maintain physical distance.

The outdoor mask requirement will go into effect this Friday, August 27, however Oregonians are strongly encouraged to immediately start wearing masks outdoors, as outlined in the news release (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/tytrs3b). The video announcement is available here (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/9qurs3b). 

Free Tips & Training to Avoid Mask Confrontations

Providing good service and enforcing mask wearing can be challenging. The Oregon Hospitality Foundation is offering complimentary access, thanks to a generous sponsorship from Anheuser-Busch, to an online video segment about mask compliance. The short video provides tips to keep customer interactions calm and avoid confrontations when you encounter resistance to mask wearing. This training segment is open to anyone in Oregon who works at an organization that holds a liquor license. Access will be available Friday, Aug. 27 through Sept. 30.

Sign up now (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/pjvrs3b) to be notified when registration is live. 

Free Workshops for Restaurant and Bar Employees and Owners

During the Tourism Stakeholder Engagement Sessions this past spring, we heard that technical assistance and workforce training opportunities were some of the top tourism-related priorities needed in helping assist Oregon communities in rebuilding the economy. To support this need, Travel Oregon has partnered with the Independent Restaurant Alliance of Oregon (IRAO) to help make education on topics ranging from diversity, equity, and inclusion in the workplace to financial fundamentals for both restaurant and bar employees and employers affordable and accessible. An IRAO workshop series focusing on these topics kicked off in July and runs through October. Find more details and register (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/5bwrs3b) for an upcoming workshop.

If you missed the recent Racial Equity for Restaurants workshop, you can view key takeaways here (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/l4wrs3b).

Visitor Profile Study RFP Closes Sept. 6

Travel Oregon is seeking a strategic partner to develop and implement a Visitor Profile Study to inform our destination development and marketing strategies based on visitors’ travel preferences, motivations and experiences. We are planning to conduct a quarterly study to understand the profile of domestic overnight and day visitors for Oregon and its tourism regions. This study will establish benchmarks for a range of metrics including past, current, and future Oregon visitors’ characteristics, perceptions and behavior. View previous statewide visitor profile studies here (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/1wxrs3b) and the regional studies here (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/hpyrs3b). Our goal is to conduct the study this fall on a quarterly basis to establish seasonal trends for visitor profile and personas by Oregon tourism regions and statewide.

Learn more and apply (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/xhzrs3b). 

Grant Writing Workshop Series

A grant writing workshop series hosted by NeighborWorks Umpqua and the Ford Institute for Community Building is being offered to all area nonprofit organizations this fall. The workshop series is designed to help beginning and intermediate grant writers in nonprofit organizations and governmental entities increase their skills for developing project proposals and successfully planning, writing and attaining grant funding.

This is a four-part series via Zoom on Thursdays from 2:30-5 p.m. The schedule is as follows:

Sept. 30 | Positioning Your Organization to be Grant Smart

Oct. 7 | Grant Writing and Grant Review

Oct. 14 | Strategic Thinking and Budgeting

Oct. 21 | Program Evaluation and Organizational Site Visits

More information is available here (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/da0rs3b). Please direct questions to Meredith Howell, PhD (mailto:mhowell@nwumpqua.org). 

Upcoming Events 

Oregon Heritage Grants Application Webinar (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/t20rs3b), Sept. 2

Oregon Heritage Grants Application Webinar (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/9u1rs3b), Sept. 9

Oregon Museums Association Virtual Conference (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/pn2rs3b), Sept. 13-15

Navigating the Healthcare Marketplace: Restaurant Owners (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/5f3rs3b), Sept. 13

Navigating the Healthcare Marketplace: Restaurant Workers (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/l83rs3b), Sept. 14

Greater Portland Athletic and Outdoor Virtual Tour (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/104rs3b), Sept. 15

Oregon Hospitality Conference (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/ht5rs3b), Sept. 19-20

Oregon Tourism Commission Meeting (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/xl6rs3b), Oct. 5

Financial Literacy for Restaurant Workers (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/de7rs3b), Oct. 5

2021 Oregon Outdoor Recreation Summit (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/t67rs3b), Oct. 17-23

Upcoming Deadlines

Oregon Wine Country License Plates Matching Grants Applications (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/9y8rs3b), due Sept. 15

Rural Opportunity Initiative Grant Applications (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/pr9rs3b), due Sept. 20

Oregon Heritage Grants Applications (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/5jass3b), due Oct. 20

Why Guides Registration (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/lcbss3b), extended through Dec. 2021

Research & Reports

Statewide Lodging Weekly Report (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/14bss3b) (Aug. 8)

Statewide Lodging Monthly Report (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/hxcss3b) (July 2021)

Oregon Monthly Barometer (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/xpdss3b) (July 2021)

COVID-19 Data Report (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/diess3b) (June 28)

American Travel Trends & Sentiment (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/tafss3b) (Aug. 23)

The Economic Impact of Travel in Oregon (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/92fss3b) (2020)

Golf and Golf Tourism Economic Impacts (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/pvgss3b) (2019)

U.S. Travel (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/5nhss3b)

Agritourism and On-Farm Direct Sales Survey: Results for the U.S. (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/lgiss3b)

Oregon Outdoor Recreation Economic Impact Study (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/18iss3b)

2020 Oregon Tourism Workforce Assessment (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/h1jss3b)

Destinations International COVID-19 Resources & Research (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/xtkss3b)

COVID-19 Travel Industry Monitor (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/dmlss3b)

Top 10 Global Consumer Trends 2021 by Euromonitor International (https://t.e2ma.net/click/dyyybh/966v8kob/temss3b)





319 SW Washington Street  Suite 700 | Portland, OR 97204 US

This email was sent to i7z7x0u9w6y3p7r3@co-labconsultancy.slack.com.
